content_1: Hong Kong. Another little egret (Egretta garzetta) found dead has tested positive for H5N1, according to the Agriculture, Fisheries and Conservation Department. This is the second egret with H5N1 found in the area within the last two weeks. The first little egret was found on November 18 and died the next day. Poland. Three wild birds (a stork and two buzzards) at a wildlife rehabilatation center in the village of Krzkalyin northeast Poland have died of bird flu, according to chief veterinarian Ludwik Bartoszewicz of the Warminsko-Mazuskie province. The Ministry of the Environment has yet to decide whether to cull the remaining birds at the center.
